ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I didn't actually learn anything substantial that has altered the way I view what a life worth living is. However, it was nice to have a space where we could openly discuss our thoughts and ideas.
I learned about the main philosophies and religions of the world and what they perceive to be a life worth living
Not much. I had great expectations for this course but I think my section was not great and stimulating at all.

I learned the importance of taking a step back and reflecting on my actions, purpose as well as beliefs. This course taught me how to approach such steps in life and what the important questions to ask are. I have always wanted to be able to take a step back and make sure that my actions align with my values, and this course taught me different belief systems and viewpoints I can approach.
Asking important questions about what I want out of life and the type of life I want to lead.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: retreat, the people in the class
Weakness: I think the sections were a little less engaging than I had hoped because the professor did most of the talking. It also was difficult to explore my thoughts and ideas freely in the papers

The class was nice in that there was a lot of time between assignments so you really got to take the time to ponder and consider the prompts before writing them. The class discussions were also interesting but could perhaps benefit from more pair discussions so that the class discussions arent as awkward

Strengths: low workload 
Weaknesses: its not stimulating

Strengths: Engaging in-class discussions, very relevant and useful readings
Weaknesses: The expectations for the first two papers are unclear. It would be helpful if we could present a draft and get peer/instructor feedback on those as we do on our final paper. It is difficult to understand and try to meet/exceed the current expectations in the current format.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Not this section. Taking this class in another section would be definitely worthwhile
Yes, if that student is interested in a survey of the major world religions and beliefs
I think it could be a nice easy credit but take it with another professor

YES! This course goes beyond other courses in that it doesn't only shape how you approach different fields/studies, but it impacts how you live your life. I think it is best to reevaluate one's values early on in life and make sure his/her actions align well with those. I believe doing this in our college years is very beneficial as it helps us a clearer vision of the life we want to have for ourselves post-graduation, which is not a very easy/clear vision to have.
